Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] epidemiological evidence indicates that excessive time spent in sedentary behaviours (too much sitting) is associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes (t2d).

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] sedentary behaviour (sitting time) has recently been identified as a risk factor for diabetes, often independent of the time spent in moderate-to-vigorous physical activity.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] this new evidence is stimulating an expansion of diabetes-related physical activity guidelines-suggesting that in addition to moderate-vigorous physical activity, reducing and regularly interrupting prolonged sitting time is likely to have important and varied benefits across the spectrum of diabetes risk.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] prolonged uninterrupted sitting is related adversely to cardiometabolic risk markers and postprandial hyperglycaemia, relative to sitting interrupted by regular brief activity breaks.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] prolonged sitting is increasingly recognized as a ubiquitous cardiometabolic risk factor, possibly distinct from lack of physical exercise.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] postprandial dysmetabolism in type 2 diabetes (t2d) is exacerbated by prolonged sitting and may trigger inflammation and oxidative stress.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] sedentary (sitting) behaviour has been shown to be associated with greater risk of cardio-metabolic health outcomes, including t2dm.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] data were pooled from 3 randomized cross-over laboratory-based trials (n = 62) that examined the postprandial blood glucose- and insulin-lowering effects of prolonged sitting vs sitting interrupted by regular brief activity breaks in overweight/obese adults who had normal or impaired glucose metabolism (2 trials) or type 2 diabetes not treated by insulin (1 trial).

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] this suggests that those with higher underlying levels of insulin resistance may derive greater metabolic benefits from regularly interrupting prolonged sitting than their healthier counterparts.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? [SEP] we hypothesize that obesity and inactivity, not hyperglycemia, cause exercise intolerance in individuals with type 2 diabetes.

Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? Does sitting for long periods despite compensatory exercise increasingly lead to type 2 diabetes? Can dementia be prevented? [SEP] based on results from large cohort studies and using population attributable risk, the commission concluded that up to 35% of dementia cases could be prevented by modifying nine risk factors: low education, midlife hearing loss, obesity, hypertension, late-life depression, smoking, physical inactivity, diabetes, and social isolation.

Can dementia be prevented? [SEP] while prevention is always better than cure, this is particularly important in the field of dementia, as current interventions are not able to modify the disease.

Can dementia be prevented? [SEP] until a cure exists, prevention through the identification and manipulation of modifiable risk factors for dementia, in general, or ad, in particular, will be our only means of reducing dementia prevalence or delaying its onset.

Does the plant pigment beta-carotene protect against cancer? [SEP] dietary supplements at high doses as part of medical therapy have been controversial, but the evidence suggests that they play a significant role in prevention and treatment of diseases as well as protection from accelerated aging that results from oxygen free-radical damage, inflammation, and glycation.

Can vitamin supplements protect against life-threatening diseases such as cancer or cardiovascular disease? [SEP] in observational studies (case-control or cohort design), people with high intake of antioxidant vitamins by regular diet or as food supplements generally have a lower risk of myocardial infarction and stroke than people who are low-consumers of antioxidant vitamins.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] these results do not support the often-heard assertion that plastic cutting boards are more sanitary than wood.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] the plastic surfaces were consistently cleaner than wood surfaces by this measure, and wood surfaces that had been hand washed five times prior to inoculation were significantly less clean than any other surfaces or treatments.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] plastic cutting boards have been preferred to wood because they can be washed in dishwashers and used in microwave ovens.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] small plastic cutting boards can be cleaned in a dishwasher (as can some specially treated wooden boards), but the dishwasher may distribute the bacteria onto other food-contact surfaces.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] the retention of bacteria on wood and plastic cutting board surfaces and their removal by washing, using protocols consistent with commercial food service, was examined.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] in general, wood is said to dull knives less than plastic, and plastic is seen as less porous than wood.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] these results suggest that wood surfaces can absorb moisture and in effect can absorb contaminating bacteria, and the difficulty in removing these bacteria may make this material less desirable from a food safety perspective.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] new plastic cutting surfaces were relatively easy to clean and were microbiologically neutral, but plastic boards with extensive knife scars were difficult to clean manually, especially if they had deposits of chicken fat on them.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] our study indicates that brief "cooking" of wooden boards at a "high" setting in a microwave oven is an effective way to kill bacteria, and thus a very simple and cheap method to protect food against cross-contaminating pathogens.

Are plastic kitchen boards more hygienic than wooden ones? [SEP] most small wooden boards (i.e., those with no metal joiners in them) can be sterilized in a microwave oven, but this should be unnecessary if accumulation of food residues is prevented.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] in 2015, the international agency for research on cancer reported that glyphosate is a probable carcinogenic.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] glyphosate (gly) is the most utilised herbicide in agriculture, although its widespread use is generating controversy in the scientific world because of its probable carcinogenic effect on human cells.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] glyphosate is the highest volume herbicide used globally and has recently been classified as a 2 a 'probably carcinogenic to humans' by the international agency for research on cancer (iarc).

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] glyphosate is a widely used broad spectrum herbicide, reported to induce various toxic effects in non-target species, but its carcinogenic potential is still unknown.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] in 2017, however, a scientific opinion of the european chemicals agency concluded that glyphosate is not proven to be carcinogenic, mutagenic or to have negative effects on reproduction.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] glyphosate is a widely used pesticide worldwide.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] glyphosate, the most widely used pesticide worldwide, is under debate due to its potentially cancerogenic effects and harmful influence on biodiversity and environment.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] since the classification of glyphosate as a group 2a substance "probably carcinogenic to humans" by the iarc in 2015, human health concerns have been raised regarding the exposure of operators, bystanders, and consumers.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] some epidemiological experts feel there is sufficient proof that glyphosate use adversely affects human health, and glyphosate has been labeled as probably carcinogenic by the international agency for research on cancer.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] the strongest evidence shows that glyphosate causes hemangiosarcomas, kidney tumors and malignant lymphomas in male cd-1 mice, hemangiomas and malignant lymphomas in female cd-1 mice, hemangiomas in female swiss albino mice, kidney adenomas, liver adenomas, skin keratoacanthomas and skin basal cell tumors in male sprague-dawley rats, adrenal cortical carcinomas in female sprague-dawley rats and hepatocellular adenomas and skin keratocanthomas in male wistar rats.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] the international agency for research on cancer (iarc) has recently classified glyphosate as a group 2a 'probably carcinogenic to humans'.

Is glyphosate carcinogenic? [SEP] although glyphosate has been considered 'environmentally' safe, its repeated use could increase the toxicological risk derived from diffuse pollution of surface and groundwater on non-target vegetation.

Do milk or dairy products promote prostate cancer? Do health benefits increase with duration and intensity of exercise? [SEP] for most of the population, increasing exercise duration and intensity beyond current recommendations appears to impart additional cardiovascular benefits; however, recent data has raised the possibility of an inflection point after which additional exercise no longer imparts benefit and may even result in negative cardiovascular outcomes.
